fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37870].
  {panel}

*Current Behavior*
The macro currently includes results for pages that have been deleted which can be confusing.

*Improvement Request*
The macro should disregard deleted pages by default or allow an option to do so.

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary
On a page with a lot of watchers, a user may opt to temporarily restrict the page to themselves if uploading a lot of attachments in order to avoid excessive notifications. However, superusers (i.e. users in the "confluence-administrators" group) watching this page will still receive notifications.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Configure Confluence 5.7.1 with an outbound mail server
# Using an admin account, create one superuser (set user as member of confluence-administrators" group), using a real email address
# Create a test page and add the superuser as a page watcher
# Restrict the page to yourself, original admin account
# Go to Tools > Attachments and upload an attachment (note: this bug also applies to removing attachments)

h2. Expected Behavior
Since the page is restricted, nobody should receive notifications except the user updating (if "Notify on my actions" option in the user's Email settings is checked)

h2. Actual Behavior
The superuser account receives a notification

h2. Important notes
* The superuser must be watching the _specific_ page. If the superuser is watching the entire space, but not the specific page, no notification will be sent.
* Attachments added via the Attachments macro will also trigger a notification
* Attachments added to the page via the Confluence Editor will _not_ trigger a notification
* Other page actions such as page edits will _not_ trigger a notification
* Only superusers are affected. Users, including those with Confluence Administrator or System Administrator global permission roles are not affected
fields.summary: Attachments added to restricted pages still send out notifications to watchers in "confluence-administrators" group

fields.description:
Hi team, 

2 bugs: 

1) Notification window not closing

Use case - if I'm editing a page, select the notifications icon in the top right, there is no way to close the notification drawer unless you click the page "title" or the ^. 

Ideal state - if in edit mode and select the notifications icon, clicking anywhere outside the notifcation drawer / window should close the notification window. 

2) Notification window and page have a double scroll

if the notification window is open, then you can scroll in both the notification window and on the underlying page. 




Thanks
fields.summary: Issues scrolling and closing Workbox (Internal Notifications drawer)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading (and still using database attachment storage) to Confluence 5.8.x, the 'ok' button under the 'confirm deletion' window does nothing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.4.0 (or any version that allows database attachment storage)
# Set Confluence to use database attachment storage
# Upgrade Confluence to 5.8.x
# Create a page and attach a file to it
# Attempt to delete the attachment

h3. Expected Results
File will delete

h3. Actual Results
The 'OK' button does not appear to have any function as shown in the attached screenshot.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:

h3. Notes
* Attachments delete as expected if using filesystem attachment storage
* Appears the issue is happening at confirmattachmentremoval.action
* Deleting versions of the attachment instead call confirmattachmentversionremoval.action which does work

h3. Workaround
# Switch to filesystem attachment storage *OR*
# Delete the version instead of the attachment
## Go to the page with the attachment
## Click the ellipsis (...) and select *Attachments*
## Find the attachment you want to delete and expand with dropdown to the left
## Delete all versions of the attachment individually

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37858].
  {panel}

We created Confluence pages and added LaTex scripts to the page.  The page display the proper symbols, but have experienced the following problems:

1. All LaTex references, i.e. symbols, are removed when the page is exported to PDF or MS Word.  The remaining text (non-LaTex) exports just fine.

This happens with both inline and block LaTex macro.

2. Printing the Confluence page intermittently removes all LaTex symbols --- very few times it includes the symbols, but most times it also removes the LaTex symbols.
fields.summary: LaTex displays properly on webpage, but cannot be exported to PDF, MS Word, or Printed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37857].
  {panel}

In older versions of Confluence, you could clearly distinguish between normal text and Info or Warning macro.

In newer versions the difference is nearly invisible. Something like th{color:#707070}i{color}s (did you notice that the i is in another color?).
I really have to turn my head to some queer angle to see the diff. Too bad !!!!
This is also true for the compare page (compare historic versions of a page).

Probably a visible border would do much (a slightly darker border very much improves the contrast perception, even if the fill colour stays the same).
fields.summary: Info / Warning hardly visible; also compare option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37856].
  {panel}

*It would be a very huge (usability) improvement*, if Space Admins would be listed on the Page Not Found and Not Permitted Pages if a user has no access to a certain page!

Currently, if a user has no access to a page (s)he does not know what to do next:
# Why is there no access or is there really no page with that name?
# Who can be contacted to grant permissions?

Since we have 145.000 users it is very annoying to get plenty of permission requests, find Space Admins and forward the users to their Space Admins.

*To improve this simple permission request process*, we wish to have at least all Space Admins listed on the mentioned error pages with mailto links.

*A very nice feature* would be an implementation similar to the Page Restrictions process. Space Admins will get informed via mail&notification and can grant permissions to users who requested this!
fields.summary: Listing Space Admins on Page Not Found and Not Permitted Pages
Add page functionality restricted by page not space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37853].
  {panel}

To reproduce, you need a page holding a rather wide table.
The table will be shown with a scrollbar at the bottom of the table.
Sometimes (rather frequent but not always) there is now a 2nd scrollbar at the very bottom of the browser window (which is actually a different frame).
See screenshot.
The bottom scrollbar scrolls in parallel to the table scrollbar, so if you pull one of these scrollbars, the other one moves at the same time.

If there are more than one wide table in the page, the excess bottom scrollbar is a replication of the first table in the page.

Issue seems to happen in the Documentation Theme only, and only if the sidebar is turned on. When I adjust the width of the browser, the excess scrollbar usually disappears.

Issue found in version 5.8.4. 
(Your "Affects Version/s) does not have this version yet selectable.)

I have not tested this behavior in other browsers than Firefox.
fields.summary: Table Scrollbar (for wide tables) repeat at the bottom of the (FF) browser

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When _Page Properties_ macro is used to wrapped tables that have been generated with _User Macro_ on a Confluence page, it then resulted in broken feature of _Page Properties Report_ macro.

Note: This issue however is *not reproducible* in Confluence 5.4.3. 

\\
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a _User Macro_ on your Confluence 5.7.4 instance that will then automatically generates a table on your Confluence page once it has been used, e.g. [Preformatted Table User Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF54/Preformatted+Table+-+Example+of+a+User+Macro].
# Include this [Preformatted Table User Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF54/Preformatted+Table+-+Example+of+a+User+Macro] on your Confluence page.
# Add [Page Properties Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Properties+Macro#PagePropertiesMacro-AddingthePagePropertiesmacrotoapage] to your page that will then wrap the [Preformatted Table User Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF54/Preformatted+Table+-+Example+of+a+User+Macro].
(i) Please be reminded to add a label to your page - you will need to specify this label in the page properties report macro.
# Create a page to list all of the available _Page Properties_ macro available on your Confluence space (this needs to be specified) by using the _[Page Properties Report Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Properties+Report+Macro#PagePropertiesReportMacro-AddingthePagePropertiesReportmacrotoapage]_.
# Notice that the _Page Properties Report_ macro is broken as per displayed in the attached screenshot (_PagePropertiesObservedBehaviour.png_).

\\
h4. Expected Results
_Page Properties Report_ macro should be able to render all of the _Page Properties_ macro once the label associated to that particular _Page Properties_ macro has been specified in the _Page Properties Report_ macro. 

\\
h4. Actual Results
_Page Properties Report_ macro is broken as per displayed in the attached screenshot (_PagePropertiesObservedBehaviour.png_).
fields.summary: Adding Page Properties Macro on Tables Generated with User Macro Resulted in Broken Page Properties Report Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37846].
  {panel}

This is an issue you guys know about, but apparently you don't respect your customers enough to resolve it.

The original ticket is "CONF-21844", which you've marked as "resolved" despite refusing to fix it.

To be clear- people who migrate from one machine to another have their backups start silently failing due to this bug. In fact, the backup job reports as having run, so it looks like things are working. People who think backups are working will be horribly surprised when they try to restore.

This should not be a difficult solution. If the "custom backup path" is disabled then use the default path instead of the custom one.
fields.summary: Backups are broken after migrations

fields.description:
In the same vein as CONF-30010, we should support the "AND" operator when it comes to using multiple labels in the Content Report Macro rather than just "OR". Even better if we can incorporate CQL into this, similar to the Page Properties Report macro in 5.8.

The use case is that users would like to further filter down pages returned in the macro using additional labels. This will also allow labels to be used in an hierarchical sense when organizing large spaces.

h2. Workaround
Use the Content by Label macro instead. It's similar but not identical (for example, this macro does not display the page author), but if you only need to list pages names that match a label pattern, then it should do the job.
fields.summary: "AND" operator support for multiple labels in Content Report Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Hi, 

When I copy a table from Excel into Confluence, sometimes it draws out the borders, but sometimes it doesn't. When it doesn't there isn't a way for me to make sure the borders are drawn out. 

Is there a workaround for this? Or do i have to manually create the table structure first in Confluence Edit mode and then copy the data from Excel? 

We're on version 4.3.5

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Previews rendering certain PDFs with additional lines not found in the PDF. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.7.5
* confluence-view-file-macro 1.4.1
* Confluence Previews 1.1.33

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Drag and drop sample pdf into the page
# Save page
# Preview the PDF


h3. Expected Results
# Preview renders the PDF without any modifications.


h3. Actual Results
# Preview renders the PDF with additional lines
 
h3. Notes
# PDF was created from a hard copy that was scanned in. 

h3. Workaround
* Use the PDF Macro to view PDF instead of Preview.

h3. Solution
* Upgrade to Confluence 5.8.4 which has confluence-view-file-macro 1.4.23 and Confluence Previews 1.2.6. No lines appear when previewing in latest version 5.8.4
fields.summary: Confluence Previews renders with additional lines for PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's not possible to copy an empty task (Task Macro). For example, if we want to use the task macro as a check box on a table, we won't need to write anything on the checkbox, only add it to the table in a specific column. Then, we try to copy this line of the table and paste it, the checkbox (task macro) is not copied.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on Confluence
# Add a table 2x2
# Write something on the first column and add a task macro on the second column, without writing anything after the checkbox added
# Copy this table line
# Paste the line copied on the second line of the table created

h3. Expected Results
* We'll have an exact copy of the first line

h3. Actual Results
* The checkbox of the second column will not be copied

h3.Workaround
* Add a new checkbox instead
fields.summary: Cannot copy the checkbox of an empty task macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copying a Confluence page that has _Inline Comments_ in it resulted in missing _Inline Comments_ on the copied page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Created a test Confluence page and added some _Inline Comments_ to this page.
# Tried to make a copy of this source page by using the _Copy_ page feature in Confluence (*... >> Copy*)
# Save the copied page. 
# Notice that all of the _Inline Comments_ associated to the source page are missing from the copied page.

h3. Expected Results
The _Inline Comments_ associated with the source page should also be copied to the copy of that particular Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
The _Inline Comments_ associated with the source page are missing on the copy of that particular Confluence page.

Hi,

We have experienced strange behavior in Confluence when moving pages from one space to another. fields.description:
Confluence has a functionality to locate orphaned pages on a space-by-space basis in Space Tools. Orphaned pages are defined as current (non-historical) pages that are not under a parent page, and do not have incoming link references, thus are less likely to be discovered.

When using MySQL, it has been observed in some instances that this functionality can take a very long time to load, or eventually hit a timeout. This is due to the underlying SQL query itself taking a long time, because MySQL sometimes does not choose the most optimal index to use. Using SQL Debug logging, we can see that the query for locating orphaned pages essentially boils down to:
{code:sql}
SELECT s.SPACENAME, s.SPACEKEY, s.SPACEID, c.TITLE, c.CONTENTID
FROM   CONTENT c,
       SPACES s
WHERE  c.CONTENTTYPE = 'PAGE'
       AND ( ( c.PREVVER IS NULL )
             AND ( c.CONTENT_STATUS = 'current' )
             AND ( Lower(s.SPACEKEY) = 'SPACE_KEY'
                   AND c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID )
             AND ( ( s.HOMEPAGE != c.CONTENTID
                     AND c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID )
                    OR ( s.HOMEPAGE IS NULL
                         AND c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID ) )
             AND ( c.PARENTID IS NULL )
             AND ( NOT EXISTS(SELECT l.LINKID
                              FROM   LINKS l,
                                     SPACES s2,
                                     CONTENT c2
                              WHERE  (
                             l.DESTSPACEKEY = s2.SPACEKEY
                             AND
                             c.SPACEID = s2.SPACEID )
                                     AND
                             ( Lower(l.DESTPAGETITLE) =
                               Lower(c.TITLE) )
                                     AND ( Lower(c2.TITLE) !=
                                           Lower(c.TITLE)
                                           AND l.CONTENTID =
                                               c2.CONTENTID )) ) );
{code}

Using {{EXPLAIN}}, it has been observed in some cases that MySQL will choose to perform an index_merge on the intersection of two indexes on the {{CONTENT}} table, {{c_prevver_idx}} and {{c_parentid_idx}}. In a large environment, this index_merge can result in hundreds of thousands of rows due to the nature of the {{CONTENT}} table, which stores metadata for all content in Confluence. This is the case even when looking for orphaned pages in a very small space.

A potential workaround is to force MySQL to use the {{c_spaceid_idx}} index by applying an [Index Hint|https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/index-hints.html]. This isolates the amount of rows needed to be scanned to the specific space, which can greatly reduce lookup time. In one case, we the time to execute went from 6+ minutes to less than half a second. The syntax is as below (note the "USE INDEX (c_spaceid_idx)" portion):
{code:sql}
SELECT s.SPACENAME, s.SPACEKEY, s.SPACEID, c.TITLE, c.CONTENTID
FROM   CONTENT c USE INDEX (c_spaceid_idx),
       SPACES s
WHERE  c.CONTENTTYPE = 'PAGE'
       AND ( ( c.PREVVER IS NULL )
             AND ( c.CONTENT_STATUS = 'current' )
             AND ( Lower(s.SPACEKEY) = 'SPACE_KEY'
                   AND c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID )
             AND ( ( s.HOMEPAGE != c.CONTENTID
                     AND c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID )
                    OR ( s.HOMEPAGE IS NULL
                         AND c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID ) )
             AND ( c.PARENTID IS NULL )
             AND ( NOT EXISTS(SELECT l.LINKID
                              FROM   LINKS l,
                                     SPACES s2,
                                     CONTENT c2
                              WHERE  (
                             l.DESTSPACEKEY = s2.SPACEKEY
                             AND
                             c.SPACEID = s2.SPACEID )
                                     AND
                             ( Lower(l.DESTPAGETITLE) =
                               Lower(c.TITLE) )
                                     AND ( Lower(c2.TITLE) !=
                                           Lower(c.TITLE)
                                           AND l.CONTENTID =
                                               c2.CONTENTID )) ) );
{code}

This bug report is to see if we can build this into the product such that List Orphaned Pages would always use the most efficient index in MySQL.
fields.summary: Inefficient "Find Orphaned Pages" function when using MysQL

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary
Confluence page URL (with '@' symbol) strips all page context with an an attachment is previewed, leading to problems when exiting attachment preview mode.

h2. Steps to reproduce
h5. Scenario 1
# Create a new user. (i.e. "test@example.com")
# Login as "test@example.com".
# Create a personal space.
# Create a test page.
(i) Please make sure that the page URL renders as http://base-url/display/~test@example.com/Test. This issue does not affect page URL such as http://base-url/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1179674 as it does not contain '@' symbol.
# Upload and insert an attachment (pdf, jpg, png, and etc).
# Click the attachment for preview (notice that the URL has been stripped of page context)
# Hit the "Back" button in the browser

h5. Scenario 2
# Create a test page with '@' symbol. (i.e. @Test)
# Upload and insert an attachment (pdf, jpg, png, and etc).
# Click the attachment for preview (notice that the URL has been stripped of page context)
# Hit the "Back" button in the browser

h2. Expected behavior
After hitting "Back", the user is brought back to the original page

h2. Actual behavior
After hitting "Back", the user is brought back to the root of the hostname. This may be the base URL of Confluence, or it may be an invalid path if Confluence normally runs with a context path appended to the hostname.

h2. Workarounds
* Instead of hitting "Back", simply click out of the preview pane by clicking outside the image or clicking the X on the upper right

* Preview the attachment using the URL that contains a page ID. (i.e. http://base-url/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1179674)

* Replace the '@' character with an ASCII code equivalent when viewing the page, i.e. '%40'. (e.g. http://base-url/display/~test%40example.com/Test). It may be possible to do this automatically via a front-end network device such as a proxy, to replace @ with %40 automatically in the URL

h2. A note on impact
The impact of this issue is especially disruptive for environments that utilize email addresses for usernames, in which case every personal space would contain the '@' character in the space key.

h2. Reference
[^URL-Change.mp4]
fields.summary: Page URL with '@' Symbol Strips Page Context when Attachment is Previewed

fields.description:
In Confluence, when adding a Table of Contents ("toc") macro to a page, the macro edit UI has a field for "*Heading Indent,*" and this should take CSS units.

If you enter a value such as "0.5em" (very typical for this sort of thing) then the parsed result, in the Confluence storage format, correctly shows the parameter as:

{{<ac:parameter ac:name="indent">0.5em</ac:parameter>}}

However, when the page is rendered the HTML shows the following CSS for the TOC list:

*{color:#d04437}div.rbtoc1433361341324 ul {list-style: disc;margin-left: 0px;padding-left: 0\2E 5em;}{color}*

This padding-left value is correctly ignored by the browser, and the list is rendered with default indenting.

Ergo, your page renderer is broken. But look on the bright side: it's going to be super easy to make a regression test for this!

I have not (yet) checked what other things are affected, but I could imagine this bug having a far-reaching impact if it's a bug in some generic units-conversion code instead of local to the TOC.
fields.summary: Confluence Table of Contents ("toc") plug-in incorrectly parses CSS units.

fields.description:
A user is allowed to upload an attachment that replaces the original attachment with an unrelated file when the user clicks on the "down arrow" at the top of the Preview page without editing the page to capture the user updating the page. The Page History does not show that the other user uploaded the attachment.

In preview, a user can replace one file with a completely different file under the same name and there is no history of it. We and other projects are using Confluence to store and track system requirements and other project documentation where it is important to track any changes to those documents. When you add or remove documents outside of preview, that activity is captured in the Page History.
fields.summary: New Preview Feature in Confluence allows any user to overwrite attachments, etc.

Summary: copy a page with linked attachment to another space will break the attachment link h3. {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37769].
  {panel}

h5. Summary:
Have a permission scheme to have user accounts that are:
# Able to log in
# Have a "Read-Only" account
# Not counted towards the license
# License scheme similar to JIRA Service Desk's Customer account

h5. Further Comments:

We are missing the option to run confluence in a 'semi' public mode. Fur is this would mean that the site itself is setup simular to the public configuration, but that we can have (unlimited) number of accounts that have read-only access.

We are putting up our documentation on a wiki based system which via sso is connected to our web-app. We would consider Confluence as the wiki, but the current licensing scheme would force us to buy over 2000 licenses, where as we only have about 5 editors. (And we are willing to pay a 'fee' to get additional read-only accounts)

A license scheme similar like the helpdesk would be really usefull for us. (Limited agents / editors, lot's of users that can create tickets)
fields.summary: Semi public permission scheme

How to reproduce to output WARN message.
# Install Confluence（64bit Linux Installer）to CentOS 6.5.
# Set 10,000.00 MB in Attachment Maximum Size of General Configuration 
# Create a space.
# Click "tool" - "Attachments", and upload a file from "Select files". (It doesn't matter how many size or what file's type)
#* Can't reproduce if the files are uploaded by drag & drop.
# Output the following WARN log. The file can be uploaded successfully.
{code}
2015-06-03 16:43:44,602 WARN [http-bio-8090-exec-1] [opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher] getMaxSize Unable to format 'webwork.multipart.maxSize' property setting. Defaulting to Integer.MAX_VALUE
 -- referer: http://192.168.56.104:8090/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=7733254 | url: /wiki/pages/doattachfile.action | userName: conf_admin
{code}



We assume that the WARN output if huge size is configured as Attachment Maximum Size and the file is uploaded from "Select files" of HTML form.
This WARN can't have any impact on Confluence, so it'd be better to remove WARN.
fields.summary: Remove WARN "getMaxSize Unable to format 'webwork.multipart.maxSize' property setting." when attaching files.

fields.description:
We migrated from one server to another recently moving from 5.6.4 to 5.7.4.  There where several issues that arose from the setenv files not match certain arguments.

5.6.4:
-Xms4096m -Xmx5460m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m
-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=/usr/java/default/jre/lib/security/cacerts -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword=changeit

5.7.4:
-Xms1024m -Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=384m
<trustStore line missing>

First issue is that when importing a large backup file you run out of virtual memory (because of the low 1G limit).  The import web page just spins ticking up the remaining time; while the java process in the background java has crashed.

Second issue, there is no way to connect to an SSL host if it doesn't know where to find the keystore.
fields.summary: Confluence 5.7.4 setenv CATALINA_OPTS issues

fields.description:
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* PosgreSQL
* Confluence 5.7.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence 5.6.6
# Alter the tables to DEFERRABLE INITIALLY DEFERRED
# Upgrade to Confluence 5.7.4

h3. Expected Results
Upgrade successful

h3. Actual Results
Upgrade unsuccessful with the following exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
[ALTER TABLE CONTENT add constraint  fk6382c05917d4a070 foreign key (PREVVER) references CONTENT(CONTENTID)]; SQL state [55006]; error code [0]; ERROR: cannot ALTER TABLE "content" because it has pending trigger events; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: cannot ALTER TABLE "content" because it has pending trigger events
{noformat}
 
h3. Causes
The tables has a foreign constraint of DEFERRABLE INITIALLY DEFERRED instead of DEFERRABLE INITIALLY IMMEDIATE

h3.Workaround
# Change all the constraint to DEFERRABLE INITIALLY IMMEDIATE so the checking will be performed after each statement.
#* Use the attached txt file to alter all the foreign key constraint to DEFERRABLE INITIALLY IMMEDIATE   [^alter constraint.txt]. 
# Continue with the upgrade again. 

h3. More information
Go to the KB https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=747606853
fields.summary: Upgrade failed with the error message: "ERROR: cannot ALTER TABLE "content" because it has pending trigger events"

fields.description:
Before reproducing, set up your instance so that there is a page with attachments which is viewable by anonymous users.

Steps to reproduce:
# Open a new session and visit Confluence as an anonymous user (new incognito window)
# View a page which has attachments
# Copy the page (Tools > Copy)
# Notice that the attachments on the page appear correctly (there is no "unknown attachment" placeholder)
# Save the page
# You will get an error "Failure when converting editor format to storage format."

Things to note:
* Copying a page must be the first action the anonymous user performs. If you first enter the editor by creating a blank page, then start to copy pages, you will not run into this issue
* The error will only occur for the first page which is copied. Subsequent copies of pages with attachments will not error out. But they will replace images with the "unknown attachment" placeholder
* The problem is on persistent per session. If you close the incognito window and start a new one, the state resets and you will run into the issue again on the next page with attachments which is copied
fields.summary: Anonymous users copying a page with attachments will throw an exception

fields.description:
h3. Summary If a new paragraph is added after a task (by hitting enter twice) that had an inline comment added to it, the inline comment will extend to the new paragraph h3. Steps to Reproduce # Install Confluence 5.7.4 # Create a page # Add a line of text to the page and convert it to a task # Save the page # Select the text on the page and add an inline comment # Edit the page # Place the cursor at the end of the text and hit enter twice to get a new paragraph # Type however much text you would like # Save the page h3. Expected Results The new paragraph will not be a part of the inline comment h3. Actual Results The new paragraph extends the inline comment, when looking at the storage format you will see the new paragraph has the exact same comment marker: {code} 1 incomplete This is a task

This is a test

{code} h3. Notes If you then perform the same routine (adding a new paragraph after the paragraph added above) the new paragraph behaves as expected. This seems to only occur after adding text after a task that has an inline comment.
fields.summary: Adding a paragraph after a task whose text includes an inline comment extends the inline comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence 5.5.2, View File Macro shows "Error rendering macro 'viewpdf' : You don't have sufficient privileges to view the attachment 'test.pdf' from page 'PDF Email Test' in space 'null" in email notification for newly created page.

In Confluence 5.7.3, View File Macro shows up as blank space and file previewer shows empty box with attachment name in email notification for newly created page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.5.2
* Confluence 5.7.3
* Gmail as mail server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure mail server for Confluence.
# Make sure that "Notify on my actions" is enabled under email settings.
# Create a new page.
# Attach PDF File to page by inserting file
# Use View File Macro to insert PDF document as an interactive presentation.
# Save page and wait for email notification.

h3. Expected Results
* Expect the email to show the macro's parameters as seen in email notification received after editing page.
** See screenshots of the emails that are expected which were generated after editing the page.
** Confluence 5.5.2 - ExpectedResults552
** Confluence 5.7.3 - ExpectedResults573

h3. Actual Results
* Confluence 5.5.2 shows the error rendering macro message
** See ActualResults552
* Confluence 5.7.3 shows blank space.
** See ActualResults573
fields.summary: View File Macro rendering incorrectly in initial email notification for newly created pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37735].
  {panel}

We just started using Confluence for ALL our company documentation, but we still use Zendesk for support ticket management. We are looking for the best way to sync content between Confluence and Zendesk Help Center articles.
It looks like Zapier would do this. JIRA is already available, but Confluence is sadly not an option. Zapier Support said it's definitely possible because you already have a 'very complete API available'. They also said you can add the app to Zapier yourself. Not sure what that involves, but since JIRA is already there, you've got one foot in the door!
Could you give me an idea of when this may be available? It would certainly rock our company socks!
Until then, keep up the good work! I've never seen a documentation program as solid as Confluence.
fields.summary: Integrate Zapier with Confluence
